awards.title: Forbes 30 Under 30 2020
awards.description: Still can't quite believe this one. I was named on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list for my work on Helperbird. Something I built to help people like me ended up on Forbes — wild.

awards.title: Best Use of Open Source Tools
awards.description: Won this for a project using machine learning with Node.js and Material Design. IBM and Intel liked the way I put it all together.

awards.title: Overall Best Poster & Project 2016
awards.description: Got top marks at CIT for a project using machine learning, Node.js, and Material Design. Felt great to have the lecturers and classmates recognise the work.

awards.title: Imagine Cup National Runner-Up 2015
awards.description: Entered Microsoft's Imagine Cup with CrossTrainr, a fitness app that connected people with similar workout interests. Came second nationally and the Microsoft team encouraged me to take it further.

awards.title: Imagine Cup National Runner-Up 2014
awards.description: Built Yeti, a tool that resized images and videos to cut bandwidth and speed up load times. Got 2nd place in the innovation category for Ireland. This one later grew into a bigger project.

awards.title: Hatchery Scholarship for Innovation
awards.description: Got a scholarship over the summer of 2012 to turn five student projects into real businesses. Weekly workshops, proper mentorship, and by September I had actual business plans done.

awards.title: Abbott Runner-Up Award
awards.description: For a SciFest competition, I built a tablet from an old laptop — added a touch screen, coded a custom interface and apps, and made a completely custom shell. Got second place and the Abbott award.

awards.title: Most Technically Innovative Award
awards.description: Won €2,000 for Project Bird, a software studio I ran with my mate Tadhg Foley focused on Windows and web 2.0 projects. Nice to get that recognised during college.

awards.title: Maths and Algorithms
awards.description: Second place in the Chemical, Physical & Mathematical Sciences category for 'A New Algorithm to Improve the Gathering of Information on Mobile.' This project ended up being the early version of what became the Yeti engine.

awards.title: Technology 2nd Place
awards.description: In fifth year, I built 'Automated Monitoring of Computer SQL Servers by Way of a Merit.' Didn't know it at the time, but it eventually grew into Tallus.

awards.title: SciFest Award for Programming x5
awards.description: Won five programming awards at SciFest — one-day science fairs where you build everything in 24 hours. The time pressure was intense but it taught me to code fast and think on my feet.

awards.title: HEANet Special Award
awards.description: Recognised for how I used networking tools for research and collaboration. Basically got an award for being handy with the internet.

awards.title: Avaya Communications Special Award
awards.description: Got recognised by Avaya for my work with networking and communication tools. Was chuffed that a company that big noticed what I was doing.

awards.title: All Ireland Title
awards.description: Won the All Ireland title from Eircom for building a web app that the judges thought was well-made and genuinely useful. This one meant a lot.

awards.title: Junior Spider Awards: Best Application
awards.description: Best application in the Junior Spider Awards. I'd put a lot of effort into making it properly polished, so it was great to see that pay off.

awards.title: Teamwork Hackathon 2015: Runner-Up
awards.description: 24 hours, 15 competing ideas. Built an internal social website concept and came second. Knackered but happy.

awards.title: Everyday Excellence Award
awards.description: Got this at Teamwork for consistently doing good work on the website. Always nice when the day-to-day stuff gets noticed.

awards.title: Above and Beyond the Call of Duty
awards.description: Teamwork gave me this for going above and beyond on the website. Apparently I was doing more than they expected — I just liked the work.

awards.title: The Faculty of Engineering & Science Scholar
awards.description: Got the Faculty Scholar title for having the top grade in my class at CIT. Made all those late nights studying feel worth it.

awards.title: Lightning Talk Smackdown Winner
awards.description: Won the Lightning Talk Smackdown at Rebelcon 2017. Talked about converting websites to Progressive Web Apps and shared a service worker template. The crowd was well up for it.

awards.title: Google Scholarship Awards
awards.description: Selected as one of 1,000 students worldwide for a Google scholarship covering their Front-End Web Developer Nanodegree. Pretty surreal getting that email.

awards.title: Project Cover Grant Winner
awards.description: Cover is a non-profit that helps people get access to opportunities and networks. Getting their grant felt like proper validation that what I was building could actually help people.

awards.title: Abe's Curated $100 Micro Grant
awards.description: A small grant from Abe's for creating open-source content — CC0, CC-BY, and GPL compatible stuff. Only $100 but it was cool to get recognised for contributing to open source.
